title: Selection Sort
description: It repeatedly selects elements from the unsorted part of a list.

title: Bubble Sort
description: Bubble Sort is the simplest sorting algorithm but isnt the most efficient in large datasets.

title: Insertion Sort
description: It works by iteratively inserting each element of an unsorted list into its correct position.

title: Merge Sort
description: Merge Sort is a divide-and-conquer algorithm that was invented by John von Neumann in 1945.

title: Quick Sort
description: Quick Sort is an efficient sorting algorithm that uses a divide-and-conquer approach to sort elements.

title: Heap Sort
description: Heap Sort is a comparison-based sorting technique based on a binary heap data structure.
